intro: Mabea occidentalis, commonly known as the western mabea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves, making it a distinctive species in its native habitat.
